definition: phases of moon, namely: new moon 朔[shuo4], first quarter or waxing moon 上弦[shang4 xian2], full moon 望[wang4] and last quarter or waning moon 下弦[xia4 xian2]
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)

sentences.english: The month phase is an important factor affecting the fishing efficiency in the squid jigging fisheries.
sentences.chinese: 月相是影响光诱鱿钓作业效率的重要因素之一。

sentences.english: Objective To determine whether menstrual onset dates are associated with days of the week or phases of the moon.
sentences.chinese: 目的确定月经起始日是否与周日和月相有关。

sentences.english: The moon was waning , and in such a waning light, it is very difficult to see the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 月相渐亏，在这样越来越弱的光线里，难以看见敌方。

sentences.english: To have understood the moon's patterns from experience must been a profound thing.
sentences.chinese: 根据经验来认识月相真是一件了不起的事情。

definition: perpetual calendar/ten thousand year calendar/Islamic calendar introduced to Yuan China by Jamal al-Din 紮馬剌丁|扎马剌丁
variant of 表盤|表盘[biao3 pan2]/watch face
sun, moon and the five visible planets
see 十二宮|十二宫[shi2 er4 gong1]
meteorological or astronomical phenomenon (e.g. rainbow or eclipse)
